title: Drawing, "Studies.  Distant views of the volcano Cotopassi, Ecuador [sic]", 1857
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower left: Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at lower left: Lugt 457d
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, with numbers at various locations; again, at lower left:   x smoke from valley / 2- Brilliant Orange like fire / 3- Warm luminous laky orange / 4- open sky -- Hazy warm pinkish / 5 Rich warm clear blue + / 6 Cirri luminous orange / 7- Mountain Hazy luminous/ 8- Crater of extinct volcano low toned where / the rim strikes rich color.  The Mountain below full / of variety in color -- many shades of green -- some parts / richly illuminated / 9- Delicate warm purple -- illuminated by the sun; and at lower center: The whole effect splendidly concentrated at 2 and 3.

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at lower left: 101- B
description: Horizontal view of the mountain range behind which the erupting cone of Cotopaxi rises.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Studies.  Distant views of the volcano Cotopassi, Ecuador [sic]", 1857.
1857. Graphite on buff paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-101-b.
